## 1. Summary
The chat discusses workarounds for handling empty objects in a 3D environment. User .hyp shaman describes an "easy mode" approach of adding an empty GLB file to a collection folder and updating the manifest JSON. User 0mka builds on this by suggesting toggling mesh visibility off on cube blocks to create functional but invisible objects. However, this approach has the drawback of carrying unnecessary memory load (256MB). 0mka proposes a compromise solution of creating a lighter block model with configurable visibility. They also share their workflow experience of using empty objects for UI elements and preferring direct manipulation (grabbing/moving) over typing position coordinates in the hyp interface.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How can I create an empty object in "easy mode"? (asked by .hyp shaman) A: Add an empty GLB to the collection folder and add its name to the manifest JSON (answered by .hyp shaman)
Q: How can I work around the need for empty objects? (asked by 0mka) A: Toggle mesh visibility off on cube blocks, though this still carries memory overhead (answered by 0mka)
